text:
I'm sending WebService(SOAP) Requests to a WebSphere App Server with Global 
Security enabled and therefore must "pass in" an ID/Password.  We need the 
ability to supply ID/Password along with our WebService (SOAP) Requests.  You 
cannot use the "Login Config Element" to supply the ID/Password.  So, if 
you're running on a Secured Server you cannot use the WebService(SOAP)Request 
because you cannot provide ID/Password authentication information.
creator: daniel.fleischer@active-endpoints.com
woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
thanks for reporting the bug, i will take a look and see if apache SOAP can
support it. When you say secure server, do you mean basic/digest authentication,
or some other form of security?

peter lin

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I took a quick look at the API. if you're referring to basic/digest auth, I can
add support for it fairly easily this weekend. if not, more details are needed.

thanks

peter

(In reply to comment #2)
> I took a quick look at the API. if you're referring to basic/digest auth, I 
can
> add support for it fairly easily this weekend. if not, more details are 
needed.
> thanks
> peter

I'm just looking for basic/digest auth.
creator: daniel.fleischer@active-endpoints.com
woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
A jmeter user saw the bugzilla entry and posted a patch to jmeter-dev. If I have
time tonight, I will try to apply the patch and get the enhancement into CVS. no
promises, but I should be able to get that patched, tested and checked in by the
end of the weekend.

peter lin

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I've made the change and committed it. unfortunately, I don't have a secured
webservice I can test at the moment. The change was pretty simple and should
work. Please give it a try and let me.

thanks
